4H2.MU.summary: Holaluz-Clidom, S.A. produces and sells electricity and gas. It generates renewable energy from wind, waste, biogas, photovoltaic solar, biomass, and hydraulic sources. The company was formerly known as Clidom Energy, S.L. Holaluz-Clidom, S.A. was incorporated in 2010 and is based in Barcelona, Spain.

54F.F.summary: Audax Renovables, S.A. engages in the generation and supplying of renewable electricity and gas in Spain, Portugal, Italy, Germany, Poland, the Netherlands, and Hungary. The company generates electricity primarily through wind and solar energy. It runs a portfolio of operating wind farms of 91 MW. The company was incorporated in 2000 and is based in Badalona, Spain.

ADX.MC.summary: Audax Renovables, S.A. engages in the generation and supplying of renewable electricity and gas in Spain, Portugal, Italy, Germany, Poland, the Netherlands, and Hungary. The company generates electricity primarily through wind and solar energy. It runs a portfolio of operating wind farms of 91 MW. The company was incorporated in 2000 and is based in Badalona, Spain.

AOR.F.long_name: Solaria Energía y Medio Ambiente, S.A.
AOR.F.summary: Solaria EnergÃ­a y Medio Ambiente, S.A. engages in the solar photovoltaic power generation business. The company develops, owns, manages, and operates photovoltaic plants with a total generation capacity of approximately 360 MW in Spain, Italy, Uruguay, and Greece. It additionally installs, repairs, plumbing, gas, electricity, cooling, heating, and air conditioning system. It also offers solar power plant custom operation and maintenance services. The company was founded in 2002 and is headquartered in Madrid, Spain.

EDPR.LS.summary: EDP RenovÃ¡veis, S.A., a renewable energy company, plans, constructs, operates, and maintains electricity generating power stations. The company operates wind and solar farms. As of December 31, 2020, it had an installed capacity of 4,966 megawatts in Europe; 6,766 megawatts in North America; and 436 megawatts in Brazil. The company was incorporated in 2007 and is headquartered in Madrid, Spain. EDP RenovÃ¡veis, S.A. is a subsidiary of EDP-Energias de Portugal, S.A.

ENER.MC.summary: Grupo Ecoener, S.A.U., though its subsidiaries, engages in the renewable energy business in Spain and internationally. The company is involved in the development, engineering, procurement, construction, operation, and maintenance of hydropower facilities, wind farms, and solar photovoltaic plants, as well as power commercialization business. It has an installed capacity of 141 MW, including 52 MW of hydropower facilities; 73 MW of wind farms; and 16 MW of solar photovoltaic plants. The company was founded in 1988 and is headquartered in La CoruÃ±a, Spain. Grupo Ecoener, S.A.U. is a subsidiary of Ecoener, S.L.U.

GRE.MC.summary: Grenergy Renovables, S.A., together with its subsidiaries, operates as an independent energy producer. It operates through Development and Construction, Energy, and Services divisions. The company designs, develops, executes, and operates renewable energy plants, including solar and wind energy plants. Its activities include promotion and commercialization of renewable energy installations; production of electric energy; and management and operation renewable energy installations. It has operations in Chile, Mexico, Peru, Colombia, Argentina, and Spain. The company was founded in 2007 and is headquartered in Madrid, Spain. Grenergy Renovables, S.A. is a subsidiary of Daruan Group Holding, S.L.

The company was formerly known as Clidom Energy, S.L. Holaluz-Clidom, S.A. was incorporated in 2010 and is based in Barcelona, Spain.

It additionally installs, repairs, plumbing, gas, electricity, cooling, heating, and air conditioning system. It also offers solar power plant custom operation and maintenance services. SPK.MC.summary: Solarpack CorporaciÃ³n TecnolÃ³gica, S.A., a multinational company, specializes in electrical generating projects, primarily in the field of solar photovoltaic energy. It engages in the development, financing, construction, operation and maintenance, and asset management of photovoltaic solar power plants. The company generates energy through 11 solar photovoltaic plants located in 4 countries that add a total capacity of 252 MWdc. It operates in Spain, Chile, Peru, Uruguay, Colombia, the United States, South Africa, Malaysia, Vietnam, and India. The company was founded in 2005 and is based in Getxo, Spain.
